entry.title: JakeWharton/singular-solution
entry.summary:
Keep your Twitter follower count at zero by blocking and then quickly unblocking any new followers

Singular Solution

Keep your Twitter follower count at zero by blocking and then quickly unblocking any new followers.

Available as a binary and Docker container.

Usage

Singular Solution consumes data from Twitter and requires you register your own Twitter application for keys: https://developer.twitter.com/en/apply-for-access

You will need an OAuth access token and access secret as well as an API key and secret.

From there, you can run Singular Solution in one of two ways:

  • Command line
  • Docker

Command-line

Install on Mac OS with:

$ brew install JakeWharton/repo/singular-solution

For other platforms, download ZIP from latest release and run bin/singular-solution or bin/singular-solution.bat.

$ singular-solution --help
Usage: singular-solution [OPTIONS]

  Block and quickly unblock all followers to keep count at zero

Options:
  --access-token KEY   OAuth access token
  --access-secret KEY  OAuth access token secret
  --api-key KEY        OAuth consumer API key
  --api-secret KEY     OAuth consumer API secret
  --dry-run            Print destructive actions instead of performing them
  -h, --help           Show this message and exit

Docker

A container with the binary is available from Docker Hub and GitHub Container Registry.

  • jakewharton/singular-solution
  • ghcr.io/jakewharton/singular-solution

The trunk branch pushes to the trunk tag on both registries, or you can use a tagged version.

The container automatically triggers the binary using cron.

$ docker run -it --rm
    -e "CRON=*/3 * * * *" \
    -e "ACCESS_TOKEN=..." \
    -e "ACCESS_SECRET=..." \
    -e "API_KEY=..." \
    -e "API_SECRET=..." \
    jakewharton/singular-solution:trunk

To be notified when the binary is failing visit https://healthchecks.io, create a check, and specify the ID to the container using the HEALTHCHECK_ID environment variable.

Docker Compose

version: '2'
services:
  singular-solution:
    image: jakewharton/singular-solution:trunk
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      - "CRON=*/3 * * * *"
      - "ACCESS_TOKEN=..."
      - "ACCESS_SECRET=..."
      - "API_KEY=..."
      - "API_SECRET=..."
      #Optional:
      - "HEALTHCHECK_ID=..."

Development

To run the latest code build with ./gradlew installDist. This will put the application into build/install/singular-solution/. From there you can use the command-line instructions instructions to run.

The Docker containers can be built with docker build ., which also runs the full set of checks as CI would.
